body:
How does this come about?

On Sat, Aug 13, 2016, 7:04 PM Brian M notifications@github.com wrote:

> Expected SETTINGS frame as the first frame. Full error:
> 
> E0813 21:58:50.338374 0
> c:\jenkins\workspace\gRPC_build_artifacts\architecture\x86\language\csharp\platform\windows\vsprojects..\src\core\ext\transport\chttp2\transport\chttp2_transport.c:1810:
> close_transport: {"created":"@1471139930.336000000","description":"Failed
> parsing
> HTTP/2","file":"c:\jenkins\workspace\gRPC_build_artifacts\architecture\x86\language\csharp\platform\windows\vsprojects..\src\core\ext\transport\chttp2\transport\chttp2_transport.c","file_line":1726,"referenced_errors":[{"created":"@1471139930.336000000","description":"Expected
> SETTINGS frame as the first frame, got frame type
> 80","file":"c:\jenkins\workspace\gRPC_build_artifacts\architecture\x86\language\csharp\platform\windows\vsprojects..\src\core\ext\transport\chttp2\transport\parsing.c","file_line":477}]}
> Status(StatusCode=Unavailable, Detail="")
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7726, or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJpudUeE_8ILQnusrTZQLJ2QjlvU0DCVks5qfneygaJpZM4Jjzf3
> .

After more research on this, it is caused by a NullReferenceException when the response is returned to the client.  I now believe it is a bug in the server side code (therefore not your bug) where they are not sending a HTTP/2 SETTINGS frame in the response, which is making Google.Protobuf.dll choke. I believe it’s throwing the error back to gRPC and that’s where the error then bubbles up to my client.

I turned on “break on all exceptions” and isolated it to this error:

System.ArgumentNullException occurred

Message: Exception thrown: 'System.ArgumentNullException' in Google.Protobuf.dll

Additional information: Value cannot be null.

I apologize for the trouble… I’m working to integrate PB’s for our company with a new partner that requires them. (http://www.index.com http://www.index.com/ )  

They are in the process of migrating from Proto v2 to Proto v3 and I think their server code is missing this detail. 

Thanks much for the quick response, I think you have a great thing going!

Brian Manlove

Dumac Business Systems

http://www.dumac.com http://www.dumac.com/ 

From: Craig Tiller [mailto:notifications@github.com] 
Sent: Saturday, August 13, 2016 10:08 PM
To: grpc/grpc grpc@noreply.github.com
Cc: Brian M brian.manlove@twc.com; Author author@noreply.github.com
Subject: Re: [grpc/grpc] Expected SETTINGS frame as the first frame, got frame type 80 (#7726)

How does this come about?

Getting same error message when attempting to place a GRPC server behind an AWS Application Load Balancer.
I actually get the same error locally on OS X when running Node client against Go server. It's weird because I don't have any sort of proxy. I can see how it'd happen on AWS ALB though.
